chameleon.core.visitor
Class ReflectiveVisitor

java.lang.Object
  chameleon.core.visitor.ReflectiveVisitor

public abstract class ReflectiveVisitor
extends Object

ReflectiveVisitor is a visitor based on Java reflection for visiting a tree of Chameleon Elements. To use this visitor, you have to do three things: 1) Make ONE interface per language with visit methods for each element that is used by that language. This interface should be provided by the module for that language. For each type A (A extends from Element) with the signature visit(A param). 2) Make a new class that inherits from ReflectiveVisitor or one of its subclasses, and that implements the interface that was made for that language in step (1). 3) Define a method for each type A (A extends from Element) with the signature visit(A param) --> If a method is lacking for one of the types, the defaultVisit method will be used that by default throws an exception called NoVisitorForTypeException. --> The defaultVisit method can be overridden by a subclass, so you can define your own default behavior. e.g. for the type NamespacePart you define a method visit(NamespacePart s){ System.out.println("This is a NamespacePart"); } 4) Decide if you want to use automatic recursive version, or manual recursion. visit(...) is used when you want the visitor to automatically visit the children nonRecursiveVisit(...) is used when you want to choose yourselve when to visit the children (manual recursion), in that case each method define in step three has to contain a call visitChildren(...). e.g. for using manual recursion with the visit method the previous example can be altered as: nonRecursiveVisit(NamespacePart s){ System.out.println("namespace " + s.namespace().name()+" {"); visitChildren(s); System.out.println("}"); }

Method Detail

recursiveVisit

public void recursiveVisit(Element element)
                    throws NoVisitorForTypeException
Recursively visits the elements. For the type A of element this method first calls visitA(...) and then recursively visits the children of element.

Parameters:
element -
Throws:
NoVisitorForTypeException - When no appropriate visit method for this type of element is defined.

nonRecursiveVisit

public void nonRecursiveVisit(Element element)
                       throws NoVisitorForTypeException
Non-recursively visits the element. When using this method you are supposed to call the visitChildren(...) manually.

Parameters:
element -
Throws:
NoVisitorForTypeException - When no appropriate visit method for this type of element is defined.

visitChildren

protected void visitChildren(Element element)
                      throws NoVisitorForTypeException
A method that (non-recursively) visits the children of this element.

Parameters:
element -
Throws:
NoVisitorForTypeException - When no appropriate visit method for one of the types of children of element is defined.

private void resursiveVisitChildren(Element e)
                             throws NoVisitorForTypeException
Throws:
NoVisitorForTypeException

defaultVisit

public void defaultVisit(Element element,
                         Exception cause)
                  throws NoVisitorForTypeException
The method called if no appropriate visit method is defined for the type of element. The default behavior of this method is to throw the NoVisitorForTypeException, override this method to change the default behavior.

Parameters:
element -
cause - The exception indicating that no appropriate visit method is defined for this type of element. This exception comes from a reflective call and is only intended for debugging purposes.
Throws:
NoVisitorForTypeException - Thrown when no default behavior is defined for this type.
